title: In Closing
historical_context: This article is part of the 40Hex zine, which was known for its focus on computer viruses and hacker culture during the early 1990s.
target_audience: Hackers, virus writers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: The author wraps up the issue, apologizing for delays and teasing upcoming content, including interviews and new virus descriptions.
summary: In this brief closing note, the author reflects on the delays in publishing the current issue of 40Hex, expressing a casual attitude towards the setbacks. They mention the anticipation of future articles that will delve deeper into the world of computer viruses, hinting at interviews with notable figures in the hacking community, including an Amiga virus writer and John McAfee. The author also teases the inclusion of specific viruses, such as the Bob Ross virus and the DIR-2 virus, promising more engaging content in the next issue.
